summary: This Q&A report reviews issues—like public misperception and insufficient support—that impact child trafficking survivors. Trafficked children detained by law enforcement may not be seen as victims, and so may not get counseling or other services. Also, service providers and others told us there isn't enough support available for certain groups of trafficked children, such as victims of forced labor. The Departments of Justice and Health...
title: Child Trafficking: Addressing Challenges to Public Awareness and Survivor Support
